abstract.p: Correction of August 13 photo with article on architctural projects in New York City in relation to cultural values embodied by Brooklyn Bridge which misidentified poet Hart Crane and gave wrong address for building at 110 Columbia Heights (S)

block.p: A picture on Aug. 13, with an article that discussed architectural projects in New York City in relation to the cultural values embodied by the Brooklyn Bridge, was published in error. It showed the poet Hart Crane (not Crane's friend Emil Opffer) standing on the roof of a Brooklyn building where Crane lived. The article also gave two erroneous addresses for the building. It was at 110 Columbia Heights, not 110 Columbus Heights or 110 Livingston Street.
